translations.Fast, modern and advanced photo manageme: Fast, modern and advanced photo management suite
translations.# Memories: Photo Management for Nextclo:
# Memories: Photo Management for Nextcloud

Memories is a *batteries-included* photo management solution for Nextcloud with advanced features including:

- **📸 Timeline**: Sort photos and videos by date taken, parsed from Exif data.
- **⏪ Rewind**: Jump to any time in the past instantly and relive your memories.
- **🤖 AI Tagging**: Group photos by people and objects, powered by [recognize](https://github.com/nextcloud/recognize) and [facerecognition](https://github.com/matiasdelellis/facerecognition).
- **🖼️ Albums**: Create albums to group photos and videos together. Then share these albums with others.
- **🫱🏻‍🫲🏻 External Sharing**: Share photos and videos with people outside of your Nextcloud instance.
- **📱 Mobile Support**: Work from any device, of any shape and size through the web app.
- **✏️ Edit Metadata**: Edit dates and other metadata on photos quickly and in bulk.
- **📦 Archive**: Store photos you don't want to see in your timeline in a separate folder.
- **📹 Video Transcoding**: Transcode videos and use HLS for maximal performance.
- **🗺️ Map**: View your photos on a map, tagged with accurate reverse geocoding.
- **📦 Migration**: Migrate easily from Nextcloud Photos and Google Takeout.
- **⚡️ Performance**: Do all this very fast.

## 🚀 Installation

1. Install the app from the Nextcloud app store (try a demo [here](https://demo.memories.gallery/apps/memories/)).
1. Perform the recommended [configuration steps](https://memories.gallery/config/).
1. Run `php occ memories:index` to generate metadata indices for existing photos.
1. Open the 📷 Memories app in Nextcloud and set the directory containing your photos.

translations.The EXIF indexes are built and checked i: The EXIF indexes are built and checked in a periodic background task. Be careful when selecting anything other than automatic indexing. For example, setting the indexing to only timeline folders may cause delays before media becomes available to users, since the user configures the timeline only after logging in.

translations.Live transcoding provides for adaptive s: Live transcoding provides for adaptive streaming of videos using HLS.
translations.Note that this may be very CPU intensive: Note that this may be very CPU intensive without hardware acceleration, and transcoding will not be used for external storage.
translations.Global default video quality (user may o: Global default video quality (user may override)
translations.You must first make sure the correct dri: You must first make sure the correct drivers are installed before configuring acceleration.
translations.Make sure you test hardware acceleration: Make sure you test hardware acceleration with various options after enabling.
translations.Do not enable multiple types of hardware: Do not enable multiple types of hardware acceleration simultaneously.
translations.Intel processors supporting QuickSync Vi: Intel processors supporting QuickSync Video (QSV) as well as some AMD GPUs can be used for transcoding using VA-API acceleration.
translations.For more details on driver installation,: For more details on driver installation, check the documentation:
translations.NVIDIA GPUs can be used for transcoding: NVIDIA GPUs can be used for transcoding using the NVENC encoder with the proper drivers.
translations.Depending on the versions of the install: Depending on the versions of the installed SDK and ffmpeg, you need to specify the scaler to use
translations.No automated tests are available for NVI: No automated tests are available for NVIDIA acceleration.
translations.Due to a bug in certain hardware drivers: Due to a bug in certain hardware drivers, videos may appear in incorrect orientations when streaming. This can be resolved in some cases by rotating the video on the accelerator.
translations.Memories uses the go-vod transcoder. You: Memories uses the go-vod transcoder. You can run go-vod exernally (e.g. in a separate Docker container for hardware acceleration) or use the built-in transcoder. To use an external transcoder, enable the following option and follow the instructions in the documentation:
